result.execSummary:
All charges against Derek John Cameron in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Derek John Cameron is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derek John Cameron

defendant.name: Cameron, Derek John
defendant.address: N8746 County Trunk B, Spring Valley, WI 54767

records.addlTxt:
TO ALSO INCLUDE 22CF91 (ARGN) and 21CM463 (STC):
CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Michael Becker   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Derek John Cameron appeared. Case called at 9:25 a.m. Court notes 22CF91 is scheduled for arraignment. There is a resolution. ADA Becker recites agreement.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 1 Possess Drug Paraphernalia in 21CM463. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 Possess Drug Paraphernalia in 21CM463. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses 22CF91. Sentencing arguments. 20 days to appeal. Court adjourned at 9:33 a.m. 

Crt orders:
In Ct. 1 in 21CM463:
- Court costs of $243.00. 60 DTP. 
- DNA Sample and Surcharge of $200.00
- Impose 30 days jail. 30 days credit. TIME SERVED.

11:02 AM Court Commissioner: Tim Heckmann, Reporter: UNMONITORED DAR. Clerk: K Kittel  ADA:  Michael Joseph Becker   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Derek John Cameron appeared.  Victim present. INCLUDES: 22CF91 and 21CM463.  S/T Officer Tyler Hiller, Hudson PD; direct by Atty Becker. Record reflects identity of DE. Cross by Atty Harrleson. Attys argue bindover. Atty Harrelson moves to amend to a misdemeanor. Atty Becker responds. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Atty Becker states he does not anticipate any more charges, are working towards resolution. Court confirms address of DE. Bond continues in form and amount. Adjourned at 11:30 am.  Arraignment scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on March 2, 2022 at 11:00 am.

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Stephanie B. or her place of employment Hilltop Service.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 22CF91 (INIT) & 21CM463 (STC):
  CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:   Bela Alexander Ballo   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Derek John Cameron appeared from jail via video. Case called at 1:03 p.m. Court notes 22CF91 is scheduled for an initial appearance. DE does not have a copy.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading. Atty Harrelson reserves on all special and jurisdictional objections. Gives argument regarding deficiencies in complaint.  Court reserves on arguments. Atty Harrelson agues no contact condition. DE is currently serving a revocation sanction from DOC and will be released March 2.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 2, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Initial appearance on February 25, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
